intro: Blainvillea acmella, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, giving it a striking, sun-like appearance. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Blainvillea acmella is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
